member.remarks: Currently, if there are duplicate names, the last one will win. CONSIDER: We could create a multi-dictionary to let lookup fail "naturally". CONSIDER: It would be nice to capture this behavior with a test.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.SuppressDiagnosticsBinder
member.summary: Causes all diagnostics related to and to be suppressed.
Create a context to compile expressions within a method scope.
Generate a class containing methods that represent the set of arguments and locals at the current scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.CompilationContext.TryParseDottedName(System.String,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Syntax.NameSyntax@)
member.summary: We don't want to use the real scanner because we want to treat keywords as identifiers. Since the inputs are so simple, we'll just do the scanning ourselves.
Return a mapping of captured variables (parameters, locals, and "Me") to locals. The mapping is needed to expose the original local identifiers (those from source) in the binder.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.CompilationContext.IsDisplayClassInstanceLocalName(System.String)
member.summary: Test whether the name is for a local holding an instance of a display class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.CompilationContext.IsDisplayClassInstanceFieldName(System.String)
member.summary: Test whether the name is for a field holding an instance of a display class (i.e. a hoisted display class instance local).

Return the set of display class instances that can be reached from the given local. A particular display class may be reachable from multiple locals. In those cases, the instance from the shortest path (fewest intermediate fields) is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.CompilationContext.GetSubstitutedSourceMethod(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Symbols.MethodSymbol,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Identifies the method in which binding should occur.
member.param: The symbol of the method that is currently on top of the callstack, with EE type parameters substituted in place of the original type parameters.
True if "Me" is available via a display class in the current context
member.returns: If is compiler-generated, then we will attempt to determine which user-derived method caused it to be generated. For example, if is a state machine MoveNext method, then we will try to find the iterator or async method for which it was generated. if we are able to find the original method, then we will substitute in the EE type parameters. Otherwise, we will return .
member.remarks: In the event that the original method is overloaded, we may not be able to determine which overload actually corresponds to the state machine. In particular, we do not have information about the signature of the original method (i.e. number of parameters, parameter types and ref-kinds, return type). However, we conjecture that this level of uncertainty is acceptable, since parameters are managed by a separate binder in the synthesized binder chain and we have enough information to check the other method properties that are used during binding (e.g. static-ness, generic arity, type parameter constraints).

member.summary: Create a context for evaluating expressions at a type scope.
member.param: Previous context, if any, for possible re-use.
member.remarks: No locals since locals are associated with methods, not types.

member.summary: Create a context for evaluating expressions within a method scope.
member.param: Previous context, if any, for possible re-use.
IL offset of instruction pointer in method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.EvaluationContext.IsDteeEntryPoint(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Symbols.MethodSymbol)
member.summary: When using DTEE with the hosting process enabled, if the assembly being debugged doesn't have a Main method, the debugger will actually stop in a driver method in the hosting process. As in the native EE, we detect such methods by name (respecting case).
member.remarks: Logic copied from ProcedureContext::IsDteeEntryPoint. Friend for testing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.EvaluationContext.SynthesizeMethodDebugInfoForDtee(System.Collections.Immutable.ImmutableArray{Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ExpressionEvaluator.AssemblyReaders})
member.summary:
When using DTEE with the hosting process enabled, if the assembly being debugged doesn't have a Main method, the debugger will actually stop in a driver method in the hosting process. (This condition is detected by .)
Since such driver methods have no knowledge of the assembly being debugged, we synthesize imports to bring symbols from the target assembly into scope (for convenience). In particular, we import the root namespace of any assembly that isn't obviously a framework assembly and any namespace containing a module type.
member.remarks: Logic copied from ProcedureContext::LoadImportsAndDefaultNamespaceForDteeEntryPoint. Friend for testing.

member.summary: Returns symbols for the locals emitted in the original method, based on the local signatures from the IL and the names and slots from the PDB. The actual locals are needed to ensure the local slots in the generated method match the original.
Include static locals for the given method. Static locals are represented as fields on the containing class named "$STATIC$[methodname]$[methodsignature]$[localname]".

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.Resources.InvalidDebuggerStatement
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Statements of type '{0}' are not allowed in the Immediate window..

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.SymbolExtensions.GetUnmangledName(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Symbols.TypeParameterSymbol)
member.summary: In VB, the type parameters of state machine classes (i.e. for implementing async or iterator methods) are mangled. We unmangle them here so that the unmangled names will bind properly. (Code gen only uses the ordinal, so the name shouldn't affect behavior).

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.EEDisplayClassFieldLocalSymbol
member.summary: A display class field representing a local, exposed as a local on the original method.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.DisplayClassVariable
member.summary: A field in a display class that represents a captured variable: either a local, a parameter, or "me".

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.EEMethodSymbol._generateMethodBody
member.summary: Invoked at most once to generate the method body. (If the compilation has no errors, it will be invoked exactly once, otherwise it may be skipped.)

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.EEMethodSymbol.GetBoundMethodBody(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticBag,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Binder@)
member.remarks: The corresponding C# method, , invokes the and the explicitly. In VB, the caller (of this method) does that.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.PlaceholderMethodSymbol
member.summary: Represents an intrinsic debugger method with byref return type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.SimpleTypeParameterSymbol
member.summary: A simple type parameter with no constraints.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.SynthesizedContextMethodSymbol
member.summary: A synthesized instance method used for binding expressions outside of a method - specifically, binding DebuggerDisplayAttribute expressions.

member.summary: Parse expression. Returns null if there are any errors.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.SyntaxHelpers.ParseStatement(System.String,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticBag)
member.summary: Parse statement. Returns null if there are any errors.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.SyntaxHelpers.ParseFormatSpecifiers(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ArrayBuilder{System.String},System.String,System.Int32,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.DiagnosticBag)
member.summary: Return set of identifier tokens, with leading And trailing spaces And comma separators removed.
member.remarks: The native VB EE didn't support format specifiers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.SyntaxHelpers.ParseDebuggerExpression(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parse a debugger expression (e.g. possibly including pseudo-variables).
member.remarks: It would be better if this method returned ExpressionStatementSyntax, but this is the best we can do for the time being due to issues in the binder resolving ambiguities between invocations and array access.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.ExpressionEvaluator.SyntaxHelpers.IsSupportedDebuggerStatement(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Syntax.StatementSyntax)
member.summary: This list is based on the statements found in StatementAnalyzer::IsSupportedStatement (vb\language\debugger\statementanalyzer.cpp). We'll add to that list some additional statements that can easily be supported by the new implementation (include all compound assignments, not just "+=", etc). For now, we'll leave out single line If statements, as the parsing for those would require extra complexity on the EE side (ParseStatementInMethodBody should handle them, but it doesn't...).

member.summary: Singleton instance of (created using default constructor).
